snippet: The two companies have been working on more than 100 software programs developed for Apple’s iOS operating system, tailoring them for use in industries.
abstract: Apple and IBM announce wide-ranging partnership intended to spread advanced mobile and data analysis technology in corporate world; are working together on more than 100 software programs developed for Apple iOS operating system, tailoring them for use in industries; deal could deepen Apple's sales to corporations and strengthen IBM's position in business software.

byline.original: By BRIAN X. CHEN and STEVE LOHR
byline.contributor: Brian X. Chen reported from Cupertino, Calif., and Steve Lohr from New York.

lead_paragraph: The two companies have been working on more than 100 software programs developed for Apple’s iOS operating system, tailoring them for use in industries.

headline.main: Apple Joins With IBM on Business Software
headline.print_headline: Apple Joins With IBM on Business Software
